answers.answer: Hello!Total knee replacement is indicated normally for osteoarthritis with loss of cushioning and cartilage in your knee joint.If your body bony structure is always similar then it is of no concern.If your orthopedician has indicated total knee replacement for rheumatoid arthritis due to loss of cartilage you can go ahead. The risk of infection in the weeks after the operation is increased if you have rheumatoid arthritis or diabetes; if you have been taking cortisone so discuss everything for your well being before going ahead.Take care!
